name: Calgary Tower
description: Take in breathtaking 360° views of the city and the Rockies from this iconic observation tower in the heart of downtown Calgary.

name: Heritage Park
address: 1900 Heritage Dr SW, Calgary, AB T2V 2X3
description: Step back in time at Canada's largest living history museum, where costumed interpreters bring the 1860s to 1950s to life with historic buildings, rides, and exhibits.

name: Gasoline Alley Museum
address: 1900 Heritage Dr SW, Calgary, AB T2V 2X3
description: Located within Heritage Park, this vibrant museum showcases a stunning collection of vintage vehicles and memorabilia from Alberta's automotive past.

name: TELUS Spark Science Centre
address: 220 Saint George's Drive Northeast, Calgary, AB T2E 5T2
description: Spark your curiosity at this interactive science museum, featuring hands-on exhibits, live demonstrations, and an immersive dome theatre for all ages.

name: Calgary Central Library
description: A modern architectural gem and cultural hub, this award-winning library offers more than books—explore innovative spaces, art installations, and community events.

name: The Hangar Flight Museum
address: 4629 McCall Way NE, Calgary, AB T2E 8A5
description: Celebrate Canada's aviation history with impressive aircraft displays, flight simulators, and educational exhibits inside a former WWII hangar.

name: Peace Bridge
description: This striking red pedestrian bridge spans the Bow River, offering scenic views and connecting downtown Calgary with the city's vibrant north side.

name: Calgary Zoo (Wilder Institute)
address: 210 St. George's Drive NE, Calgary, AB T2E 7V6
description: Home to animals from around the world, the Calgary Zoo offers immersive habitats, interactive exhibits, and conservation-focused experiences for visitors of all ages.
